_comments._editing_guide: The fields below can be edited to customize the department page content. These texts will appear on the public website.
_comments._introText: Short introduction that appears at the top of the department page
_comments._descriptionText: Detailed description - you can use placeholder variables like {jurisdiction.name}, {department.name}, etc.
_comments._roleText: Description of the department's role and importance to the province
_comments._programsHeading: Heading for the programs and services section
_comments._programsDescription: Description of what programs and services this department offers

introText: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry manages Ontario's natural resources, forests, and wildlife, balancing conservation with sustainable economic development and outdoor recreation.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry spent $1.1B in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 0.5% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports forest management, conservation, and natural resource stewardship.
roleText: Ontario's natural resources are fundamental to both the economy and environment. This ministry manages forests, wildlife, and natural resources while providing outdoor recreation opportunities and wildfire protection services.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry operates programs including forest management, wildlife conservation, wildfire suppression, natural resource development, outdoor recreation, and environmental monitoring.
